# ARGeometrySource

**Class**

Mesh data in a buffer-based array.

## Declaration

```swift
class ARGeometrySource
```

## Overview

Mesh-anchor geometry ([doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARMeshGeometry]) uses geometry sources to hold 3D data like vertices, and normals, in an efficent, array-like format. A Metal buffer wraps the data, and other properties specify  how to interpret that data.

In the case that [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARGeometrySource/componentsPerVector] is greater than 1, the element type of the geometry-source array is itself a sequence (pairs, triplets, and so on).

## Accessing Geometry

- **subscript(_:)**: Provides the source float triplet at the subscripted index.
- **subscript(_:)**: Provides the number at the subscripted index.
- **buffer**: A Metal buffer that contains a list of vectors.

## Getting Geometry Information

- **componentsPerVector**: The number of scalar components in each vector.
- **count**: The number of vectors in the buffer.
- **format**: The type of vector data in the buffer.
- **offset**: The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the buffer.
- **stride**: The length, in bytes, of the start of one vector in the buffer to the start of the next vector.

## Accessing Geometry Data

- **vertices**: The vertices of the mesh.
